result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael K. Speirs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: 25% of prison wages to be applied towards restitution to Marathon County Jail

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs unless prescribed and only as prescribed.  

No contact with K.K.

Assessment, treatment as deemed appropriate by agent.  

Complete SAFE program; or Domestic Violence program as equivalent to SAFE program. 

DNA sample.

Case Called: 2:03 pm
Includes 14CF191 and 14CF52.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner. Defendant appears in person and with Atty John Wallace via phone. 
Date and time set for a Bail/Bond Hearing. 
State refers to the Compass Letter that was received by the Court. Atty Wallace makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: Bond amount continues. CONDITIONS: No abusive Contact with victim, not to reside with the Victim, Defendant to continue to go to counseling. 
Adj: 2:07 pm

Case called: 1:52 pm 
Clerk: Kim
14CF52 and 14CF191
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner;  Defendant appears in person and with Atty John Wallace.
Date and time set for Final Pre Trial and bond modication.  State reports parties have reached an agreement, and recites agreement.  Defendant is requests bond modification.  COURT informs defendant he will no longer be on bond if he takes plea today.  Defendant is not in agreement with State's offer.  COURT takes 5 min. recess.  OTR:  1:58 pm 
BOTR:  2:04 pm  Same appearances.  Atty Wallace requests plea be adjourned in 4 to 5 weeks as his client is taking prescription drugs, and will be having surgery.  Defendant is requesting no contact be dropped.  COURT questions defendant.  Defendant states if he signs any documents it won't be legal because of the medication he is on.  State does not want to proceed w/out victim, parties are participating in joint counseling, and victim does want to have contact.  Atty Wallace tries to make phone with victim. COURT adjourns plea to Wed. 7/15/15 at 1:00 pm in Br. 2 courtroom.   State to contact victim if available.  COURT wants direction from counselor.  Victim may appear in person or by phone.  Atty Wallace to contact Compass Counseling for report and have faxed to Court. Adj: 2:14 pm pm
for Adjournment of JT-GRANTED
